amendment.description: Amendment limits the U.S. share of payments for the cost of NATO expansion to 10 percent of the total cost or $2 billion whichever is less; and if at any time the U.S. share exceeds 10 percent, then no funds may be expended until the percentage is reduced to 10 percent.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to prohibit any increase of U.S. Armed Forces personnel permanently stationed in Europe due to increased membership in NATO.

action.text: Frank (MA) amendment (A010) modified by unanimous consent. Modified provisions made in order by sec. 8(b) of H. Res. 169, limiting any increase in the U.S. share of the total cost to NATO as a result of admitting new member nations into NATO to 10% of the cost of expansion or a total of $2 billion over 12 years, whichever is less.
On agreeing to the Frank (MA) amendment (A010) as modified Agreed to by voice vote.
